questions.question: What is periphyton?
answers: A collection of species that cling to submerged plants in aquatic systems
A living multi-species that gets energy from dead, submerged plants
A collection of dead microorganisms that cling to underwater plants
A collection of dead algae that cling to submerged plants in aquatic systems

questions.question: Which is an example of how other organisms in the Everglades benefit from periphyton?
answers: It provides food to small fish, aquatic insects, snails, and frogs
It forms a protective barrier between decomposing plants and other organisms
It provides an indication the water in an ecosystem is polluted
It forms a barrier in estuaries to prevent organisms from salt water and fresh water from interacting
